args: Hmm, no. The waves are a lighter hue.

The water farther out runs a deep cerulean,
so I'll need to add darker tones for depth.
And also there, where sea meets sky in a 
seamless gradient of blue.

＂Lured to the water's edge by the ocean's
song, our prince suddenly beheld the
beautiful princess who lived in the deep.＂
Ah, a storybook meeting if ever there was.
Hello, Norwin. Working on your next tale?
You are too kind. However, I am glad to\nhear you enjoy it, for my next picture book\nwill be a rousing tale of the sea.
I can't wait! ...Unless it's got another\nof your trademarked Norwin grimdark\nendings, in which case, hard pass.
Heh. I shall do my best to avoid\nsuch an unhappy fate.
I'm glad you're able to write\nhappy stories again, Norwin.
As am I—and I have you to thank for it.
Ooo! Is this beach-party gossip?\nI am SO in. Dish!
Oh wow, this is SUUUPER pretty...\nIt's like you put the whole ocean\ndown on the page or something!
I KNOW, right? Ol' Norwin here's\na classy picture-book author.
Picture books?! Ooo, I wanna read one!\nPlease please please pleeease?!
Of course. I always carry a few finished\nworks with me to read to the children\nI meet in my travels.
Yay! Okay, then I'm totally gonna\nstart with...um...this one!

Aw, that was SOOO good! *sniff*
The princess totes deserved her...
*sniff* happy ending... *sniff*
I'M SO PROUD OF HER! WAAAAAH!
Your tears are the highest praise an author\ncould hope for, miss. Oh, and please help\nyourself to this handkerchief.
*sniff* Oh! Th-thanks. *HOOOONK*\nIt's just, like, seeing her happy made\nme all teary and then... *HOOOOOONK*
Like, I was scared when she got turned\ninto that creepy monster, but THEN the\nnice wizard guy totally turned her back!

I know it's crazy dumb, but I was kinda...
jealous? I mean, who WOULDN'T want
to be zapped by a spell that made you
happy forever and stuff!
I see many similarities between the\nprincess in my story and yourself.

Remember all the stories about how your
songs led sailors to their doom? None of
them were true, but they turned into
frightening legends all the same.
But you got through that; you found the\ncourage to walk onto that stage and share\nyour gifts with the entire world.
Aw, that was only 'cause you\nand your friends helped me out.
We need you to sing for us so Barbary\nlowers her defenses. Will you help?
If I hadn't met all you guys, I'd still just\nbe singing to myself right now.
You gave me a stage, and I am\nfor real suuuuper grateful.
If that meeting wasn't magic,\nI'm not sure what is.
Do you now understand why I see you\nas a faerie-tale princess?
Hee hee! You totally know\nhow to sweet-talk a girl!

But yeah, I probably shouldn't be all
envious and stuff. I mean, I'd just be
a total Greedy Gus to wish for MORE
than I have in my life now.
Like wishing my song could reach him...
Eeep! I mean, uh...whatever I'm gonna\ngo swimming now byeeeee!
I wonder what she meant\nby that last cryptic aside?
Yeah, and I wonder WHO she meant?\nThese days, her song should be able\nto reach any dang person she wants!
Do you know something about this,\n{player_name}?
I think it may be about the incident that\nstarted her rumors in the first place...
Ohmigosh, I am a TOTAL joke. I mean,\nwho envies storybook princesses?
Is that not the purpose of stories?
Fantasy makes possible what reality can\nnever provide. It's only natural for envy\nto arise in such circumstances.
Might I bend your ear with another tale?
Long ago, in the depths of the seas,\nlived a mermaid who sang with the\nvoice of an angel.

One day, as the sea roiled and churned in
a terrible storm, a ship was dragged 'neath
the waves, and the mermaid gave her all
to save a lost crewman.
But the ship's other crew and the villagers\nwho took in the rescued crewman blamed\nher for the ship's fate.

The prince was kind enough to share
some of it with me. Apologies if I have
perhaps overstepped my bounds in
inquiring about you.
Is the man you saved that day the one\nyou wish to share your song with now?
Yeah. He's...he's my friend.\nMy really GOOD friend.
But gosh, this was, like, decades ago.\nI was off singing by myself like always\nwhen I heard him start talking to me.
His name was Paul, and he told me that\nmy voice was... Well, I don't wanna get\nall braggy, but he said really nice stuff.
But was your good name not restored\nafter that whole sordid affair?
Surely your reputation these days is as\na songstress and not a sea monster.
If you wish to share your song with Paul,\nI see nothing which might prevent that.
Yeah, he lost his hearing the day\nhe almost drowned.

No, Norwin! Don't be all sad, it's fine!
I mean, yeah, he can't hear my voice or
whatever, but he can still see my smile.
That's good enough. ...Or it should be.
But I'm still super greedy, and I just wish\nthere WAS some way for him to hear me!\nJust, like, one more time, you know?
Singing is sorta the only way I have\nto express what I feel for him.
Ah, so that is the magic you yearn for.

I know, I'm the WORST. I should totally
just be happy that I can sing in public
again and not have everybody wanna
attack me with pokeforks or whatever.
Anyway, that's how this story ends,\nso let's stop being all weird about\nstuff that can't happen and—
Will you permit me to aid you\nin pursuing this dream?
Sorry, I thought I made this all obvious.\nHe can't hear! Like, at ALL!
Though your voice may not reach him,\nyour feelings are another matter.
We need only borrow the power of\npicture books to make this so.
